projectSlogan: Find what's lost, surrender what's found
projectDescription: PUPFIND is a web-based application designed to track missing items at the Polytechnic University of the Philippines. The system facilitates the reporting of missing items and streamlines the process of matching them with found items, providing a platform to enhance the retrieval of lost valuables.

projectSlogan: Collaborate and solve coding challenges together
projectDescription:
LeetCollab is an innovative online platform built for collaborative coding and algorithm problem-solving. It enables users to tackle coding challenges together in real-time, fostering a dynamic learning environment. LeetCollab provides a rich set of collaboration tools, including a live chat feature for seamless communication and an interactive whiteboard for real-time visual problem-solving and diagramming. The platform also supports a shared coding environment, where users can simultaneously write, edit, and run code, making it an ideal space for pair programming, study groups, and algorithm practice.

Whether you're preparing for coding interviews or simply honing your problem-solving skills, LeetCollab offers a community-driven experience designed to make learning more interactive and engaging.

projectSlogan: Official Website for PCA Internal Audit and audit questionnaires
projectDescription: The official website for the Internal Audit Department of the Philippine Coconut Authority (PCA). The platform streamlined audit operations by providing a secure login system for department focal persons nationwide, enabling them to answer auditor-issued questionnaires and upload supporting documents. I also implemented a document validation workflow, allowing auditors to review, accept, or reject submissions based on completeness and compliance. This system digitized and centralized PCA's audit preparation process, significantly reducing manual effort, improving traceability, and fostering more efficient cross-departmental coordination.
